note.p: Blacksmith and farrier, and fly proprietor. Son of William Reeves, blacksmith, of Cudham, Kent. Of Down, Kent. Married Jane Brooks, daughter of CD’s gardener William Brooks, at St Luke’s, Finsbury, Middlesex, in 1858. Member of the Down Friendly Society, 1881.
Census returns of England and Wales 1841 (The National Archives: Public Record Office HO107/481/14/27/5), 1851 (HO107/1606/247/4), 1861 (RG9/462/71/3), 1871 (RG10/875/36/6), 1881 (RG11/855/88/11)
London, England, Church of England marriages and banns, 1754–1921 (Ancestry.com, accessed 15 September 2016)
Post Office directory of the six home counties 1862
